fields.description:
Why are we forced to a very narrow editing window like this one. (See attached picture)

When I am reading or editing a script the size of the window is annoying.
I would like to take almost the full width of the browsing window to edit the text.
fields.summary: The size of the scripting window is annoying

fields.description:
I previously had the Bitbucket trigger working properly, but after upgrading Bitbucket from 4.3.0 to 4.6.1 and Bamboo from 5.10.0 to 5.11.3, commits are no longer triggering builds.
I've checked the logs for any errors, but nothing is showing up.  I have disabled and reenabled the authentication on the application link (on both sides) and that seems to have helped for a single build, but is no longer picking up changes again.
fields.summary: Bamboo "Bitbucket server repository triggered" trigger stopped working on upgrade

fields.summary: User without repository create privilege causes exception

fields.description: Bamboo provides a variable bamboo.ManualBuildTriggerReason.userName.  Some customers will want to send notificaitons or email to users who run manual jobs. An good improvement for Bamboo will be to add a variable such as "bamboo.ManualBuildTriggerReason.userName.email" to return the value if it has been set for the user.
fields.summary: Variable to get email address for user running manual build

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When running tasks or deploying files it is occasionally required to target multiple servers. Currently Bamboo's ScpTask and SshTask only allow adding ONE hostname. This means that if we need to copy files to a hundred servers, say, we will need to add a HUNDRED ScpTasks.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be good if multiple hosts could be added to each ScpTask or SshTask.

h3. Workaround

The workaround is to use a ScriptTask that then invokes the multiple ssh or scp commands.
fields.summary: Allow multiple hosts in an SCP/SSH Task's "host" field

fields.description:
I'm using Bamboo 5.9.7 build 5920 - 14 Oct 15 and there are times I would like to be able to view just the Skipped and Quarantined tests for a given job.

Right now, there are quick filters (?is this the right term?) for "Failed tests" and "Successful tests" (and the Successful tests even shows the number... failing does not... why?).  I'd like the same views for Skipped and Quarantined tests.

I'm using the built-in JUnit task/plug-in to parse the tests results.
fields.summary: Specific Job Tests view should have quick filters for Skipped and Quarantine

fields.description:
Our bamboo instance is integrated with an active directory instance for user and group management. The naming convention used to create the active directory groups specifies a # character at the beginning of the name. The Bamboo bulk permissions edit functionality fails with an error when adding a group name starting with an # character. Executing the same change directly against a single project using a group name that starts with a # character does not cause a problem and allows the group to be added successfully.

Steps to reproduce
# As an administrator select the "Overview" menu item from the Settings dropdown.
# Select the "Bulk Edit Permissions" option from the left hand list of options.
# From the "Bulk edit plan permissions wizard" select the set of build plans that you wish to execute the bulk operations against changes against and click Next.
# Add a group starting with # character to the list of groups and select the permissions View ,Edit, Build and Admin. Also added two additional groups that did not contain the # character.
# Click the Next button to confirm the build plans that would have the groups added to them.

Expected result
The Confirm bulk edit plan permissions would list the build plans that would have the groups added to them.

Actual result
A stack trace is shown as follows complaining about the group permission being unsafe.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: In expression [@ww.hidden name='${grantedPermission}' value='true' /] ['${grantedPermission}'] evaluated as [bambooPermission_group_#ipa_whitelabel_dev_iam_ADMINISTRATION] was deemed unsafe

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Moving certain plan will have the error "cannot save merged build definitions"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two Projects: ProjectA and ProjectB
# Create PlanA in ProjectA and PlanB in ProjectB
# Set PlanA to have produce a ArtifactA
# Set PlanB to have "Artifact download" task to download ArtifactA
# Create a branch plan in PlanB
# Move PlanA from ProjectA to ProjectB

h3. Expected Results
Move successfully

h3. Actual Results
Move fail with the error message "Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only" in the UI.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2016-06-08 16:35:18,441 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [TransactionalPlanMover] Finished updating artifacts
2016-06-08 16:35:51,616 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher] There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event [com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.events.ChainMovingEvent[source=com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.move.TransactionalPlanMover@1830b4d9] plan=SHD-TOOL] from the invoker [SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker{method=public void com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.artifact.ArtifactDownloaderTaskEventListener.onChainMoving(com.atlassian.bamboo.chains.events.ChainMovingEvent), listener=com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.artifact.ArtifactDownloaderTaskEventListener@129d624c}]
java.lang.RuntimeException: cannot save merged build definitions
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher$1$1.run(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:46)
	at com.google.common.util.concurrent.MoreExecutors$DirectExecutorService.execute(MoreExecutors.java:299)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.dispatch(AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.event.spi.BambooEventDispatcher.dispatch(BambooEventDispatcher.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.LockFreeEventPublisher$Publisher.dispatch(LockFreeEventPublisher.java:260)
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.LockFreeEventPublisher.publish(LockFreeEventPublisher.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.move.TransactionalPlanMover$1.run(TransactionalPlanMover.java:281)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.BambooPluginUtils$Runnable.call(BambooPluginUtils.java:192)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.BambooPluginUtils$Runnable.call(BambooPluginUtils.java:182)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.BambooPluginUtils.callUnsafeCode(BambooPluginUtils.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.move.TransactionalPlanMover.publishChainMovingEvent(TransactionalPlanMover.java:276)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.move.TransactionalPlanMover.moveSinglePlan(TransactionalPlanMover.java:202)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.move.TransactionalPlanMover.moveMaster(TransactionalPlanMover.java:139)
...
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: cannot save merged build definitions
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:122)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanHibernateDao.save(PlanHibernateDao.java:456)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.PlanHibernateDao.save(PlanHibernateDao.java:51)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1139.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:317)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:190)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:157)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor$1.proceedWithInvocation(TransactionInterceptor.java:98)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAspectSupport.invokeWithinTransaction(TransactionAspectSupport.java:262)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:95)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
...
2016-06-08 16:35:51,916 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [MoveBuilds] Unable to move plans
com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.MovePlansException: org.springframework.transaction.UnexpectedRollbackException: Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.move.MovePlanBatchCoordinator.movePlans(MovePlanBatchCoordinator.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.plan.move.MovePlanServiceImpl.movePlansToProject(MovePlanServiceImpl.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.actions.build.admin.MoveBuilds.execute(MoveBuilds.java:158)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Click on the Move button again
OR
# Remove the "Artifact download" task first before moving the plan again

h3. Notes
# The first workaround depends on the number of tasks and branch plans
#* If there are two "Artifact download" tasks to download ArtifactA and two branch plans in PlanB, the number of time to click on the Move button is (2 x 2 + 1) = 5
#* If there are other plans with "Artifact download" tasks that will download ArtifactA and have branch plans as well, the number will increase too, eg:
PlanB have 2 "Artifact download" tasks and 2 branch plans = 2 x 2 = 4
PlanC have 3 "Artifact download" tasks and 4 branch plans = 3 x 4 = 12
Total number to click Move button = 4 + 12 + 1
# Incorrect setting in "Artifact download" task 
#* If PlanB have two stages and both stages have "Artifact download" task to download ArtifactA, only the second stage in PlanB is updated to refer to the correct project. The first stage is still referring to the ProjectA
#* Running the build will have an error even though the "Artifact download" task is disabled
fields.summary: Unable to move a plan that provides an artifact to another project with a plan that consumes it

fields.description:
LDAP pooling is not working properly in Bamboo. We have the following set in our atlassian-user.xml file.
{code}
<securityProtocol>ssl</securityProtocol>
<poolingOn>true</poolingOn>
<maxSize>100</maxSize>
<initSize>1</initSize>
<prefSize>5</prefSize>
<debugLevel>none</debugLevel>
<timeout>300000</timeout>
<initialContextFactory>com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory</initialContextFactory>
<batchSize>100</batchSize>
<timeToLive>0</timeToLive>
<userSearchAllDepths>true</userSearchAllDepths>
<groupSearchAllDepths>true</groupSearchAllDepths>
{code}
When we go to the Groups page in the Bamboo UI about 20 connections to our ldap server is made and remain established connections. After waiting 15 seconds once the first page of groups to appear, I click on the page 2. You would think the 20 connections in the LDAP pool would be reused since they are already open and established but that is not the case. Instead it opens another 20 so now there is 40. This keeps occurring until the pool reaches 100. Then an error in the log is thrown and I can no longer access the groups page in bamboo until the timeout occurs (5 minutes).
{code}
2016-04-21 16:52:41,763 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-10] [LDAPMembershipToUsernamePager] Error converting search result: cn=some-group: null:null:
{memberuid=memberUid: uid=xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx}
into list of members as usernames.
com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.repository.LdapConnectionFailedException: javax.naming.CommunicationException: Timeout exceeded while waiting for a connection: 30000ms
{code}
There are two issues here. The first issue is the error. Once the maxSize is reached on the pool, should it even be trying to connect to the LDAP server? Should a friendly message occur stating the pool max has been reached?
The second issue is that pooled LDAP connections are not being reused. This defeats the whole purpose of using the pool.

You can see that amount of connections growths when user paginates over groups (~100 groups)
{code}
netstat -na | grep -c 636
{code}
Issue doesn't exists for browsing users (~500 users).
fields.summary: LDAP connections are not reused when LDAPS protocol used

fields.description:
Stage listener may skip triggering deployment environment randomly.
The reason is in code which decide if deployment should be triggered. It checks status of chain and triggers deployment only if chain state is "InProgress" which works only if listener was triggered before chain complete
fields.summary: After successful stage trigger may not trigger deployment

fields.description:
When I have two stages in a plan, I sometimes need to download an artifact from the first stage into the second stage.  For instance, the first stage test & creates a bundled source build of my code, and the second stage will create a platform-specific binary of it.

It's cumbersome in the "Artifact Download" task to find the correct plan - I would like to just say "the same plan" or "this plan" or something.  This would also make it a lot quicker to clone one plan to another, because I wouldn't need to drill in & change the artifact download settings.
fields.summary: Download artifact from same plan, without explicitly naming plan

fields.summary: be able to tell who stopped the build

fields.summary: En dash character in Plan name breaks Dependencies configuration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In 5.11 a change was made to who can modify linked repositories. With the new "Create Repository" permissions, "plan administrators" can no longer add repositories unless they have the global "Create Repository" permissions.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Allow Plan administrators to add repositories regardless of their Global permissions.
fields.summary: Plan administrators can no longer add repositories to a plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If, by mistake or intentionally, a white space is present at the beginning of a release name, then Bamboo won't be able to deploy the release returning the error:
"Deployment release with version xxxxxx cannot be found"


h3. Environment
5.12.0-D20160518T090318


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Bamboo open a deployment project
# Click on the *Deploy* button on the upper right corner of the page and select an environment where to deploy
# In the next screen, select *Create new release from build result*
# Enter the release name, start the deployment and see that everything works fine the first time
# Repeat steps 1 to 3 but this time select "Promote existing release to this environment" and select the release you just created.

h3. Expected Results
No error message is returned and the release is correctly deployd

h3. Actual Results
The error message "Deployment release with version xxxxxx cannot be found" is displayed

The below error message is in the logs:
{noformat}
@40000000574fe8bf143f960c 2016-06-02 10:05:09,338 WARN [ajp-nio-127.0.0.105-8009-exec-41] [TextProviderHelper] The first TextProvider in the ValueStack (com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.versions.actions.ViewDeploymentVersion) could not locate the message resource with key 'Release:  bingel-2.0.3-beta-16 / cms-1.13.10'
@40000000574fe8bf1448a65c 2016-06-02 10:05:09,340 WARN [ajp-nio-127.0.0.105-8009-exec-41] [TextProviderHelper] The default value expression 'Release:  bingel-2.0.3-beta-16 / cms-1.13.10' was evaluated and did not match a property.  The literal value 'Release:  bingel-2.0.3-beta-16 / cms-1.13.10' will be used.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
- This happens because the white space at the beginning of the release name is stripped away from the url called when deploying and this returns an error because the release name in Bamboo DB still has the white space at the beginning

h3.Workaround
Remove the leading white space from the release name in Bamboo DB.
fields.summary: If a white space is present at the beginning of a release name then Bamboo cannot find it for deployment

fields.summary: The "Using the Bamboo REST APIs" documentation uses a wrong/unexisting endpoint in the REST authentication example
Make Branch Expiry scheduled time configurable

fields.description:
By default, Git in OSX uses {{osxkeychain}} credential.helper to cache credentials.

In some cases, this causes issues. There isn't a need to cache credentials as Bamboo supplies credentials every time. 

Bamboo should check for credential helper config and unset it if any since a credential is provided during the checkout
fields.summary: Override Git cache in git commands

fields.description: Currently we have no logs for the Bamboo Windows Installer execution. This is very important as it is when the user sets both the installation and home directories for Bamboo. It is also during this process that the installer detects whether there's an existing Bamboo installation in the system, and if we choose to update the existing install, it's also during this process that the old files are removed and the new ones extracted to that directory. All those steps happen during the installation process in Windows and there's no log file for that. If anything goes wrong, due to the absence of installer logs, users might not be able to get a clear indication of what didn't work.
fields.summary: Installer logs for Windows Installer

fields.description:
It would be great to have the Bamboo Windows Installer to automatically suggest and install each version of Bamboo in a version numbered folder like Bitbucket Server. Here's an example of how the Bitbucket Server installation path is organized:

{noformat}
Directory of C:\Atlassian\Bitbucket

02/16/2016  05:43 PM    <DIR>          .
02/16/2016  05:43 PM    <DIR>          ..
10/15/2015  11:47 AM    <DIR>          4.0.2
02/16/2016  05:43 PM    <DIR>          4.3.1
{noformat}
fields.summary: Windows Installer to install each version in a version numbered folder

fields.description:
h3. The problem
After configuring a mail server with authentication, it's not possible to remove the credentials to use the anonymous authentication.
Only the logs report errors, no error is thrown in the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an SMTP mail server that accepts anonymous connections
# Create a mail server in Bamboo with a username and password, and save it
# Send a test email and verify it is working
# Edit the mail configuration and remove the username and password and save it
# Send another test email and verify the problem

fields.description:
*Summary*
Deployment project summary and releases throws error when an environment doesn't have any permission set.
{noformat}
Background page refresh cannot contact server. Please ensure Bamboo server is available.
{noformat}

Any release in the deployment project will throw _Access Denied_ error even the user has permission to the related environment.

In logs:
{noformat}
2016-06-02 18:47:26.223070500 2016-06-02 18:47:26,217 WARN [ajp-nio-127.0.0.105-8009-exec-2] [AuthorizationLoggerListener] Authorization failed: org.acegisecurity.AccessDeniedException: Authentication mfahd has NO permissions to the domain object com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.environments.EnvironmentImpl@1b40376; authenticated principal: org.acegisecurity.adapters.PrincipalAcegiUserToken@89fcc70f: Username: mfahd; Password: [PROTECTED]; Authenticated: true; Details: null; Granted Authorities: ROLE_USER, ROLE_RESTRICTEDADMIN; secure object: ReflectiveMethodInvocation: public abstract com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.environments.Environment com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.environments.service.EnvironmentService.getEnvironment(long) throws org.acegisecurity.AccessDeniedException; target is of class [com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.environments.service.EnvironmentServiceImpl]; configuration attributes: [ROLE_USER, ROLE_ANONYMOUS, AFTER_ACL_READ]
{noformat}

*Expected behavior*
Project summary should load just fine and the releases that are not related to the restricted environment should be accessible.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Get a user with access to Bamboo - restricted admin user
# Create a deployment project and link it to a build plan that has some builds
# Add the user into the deployment project's permissions to have all permissions
# Create 2 environments *ENV1* and *ENV2*
#* Edit *ENV1* permission to give all permissions to the user
#* Edit *ENV2* to not have any permission set - untick all boxes
# Run a few deploys for both environments
# Login as the user above, try to access the project's summary page and any of the releases

 !summary.png|thumbnail! 
 !releases.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Deployment project summary and releases throws error due to permission in environment setting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While Bamboo is setting up and running an import, browsers or scripts can already request information from Bamboo.
Bamboo can not yet serve these requests, and throws a "Container is not setup" error.
This error is not fatal, but results in an import being flagged as failed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up new Bamboo and import in existing data.
# Attempt to access Bamboo while the import is running.

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo import completes and you're able to access successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Bamboo import completes successfully, but at initial access shows import failed.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{code}
2017-02-16 06:44:42,604 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-25] [XmlMigrator] Import completed. 3 h
2017-02-16 06:44:43,284 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-25] [ImportExportManagerImpl] Exception occurred during import
com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Container is not setup
{code}

The bamboo.cfg.xml file shows setupStep with 'setupSelectImport' even though the import completed.
{code}
  <setupStep>setupSelectImport</setupStep>
{code}

h3. Workaround
# Stop Bamboo
# Modify bamboo.cfg.xml and change 'setupSelectImport' to 'complete'.
{code}
  <setupStep>complete</setupStep>
{code}
# Start Bamboo
fields.summary: "Container is not setup" message during import results in import being reported as failed

fields.description:
We use Bamboo cloud and local Bamboo agents (version 5.12.0-D20160518T090318)

We have 2 stages in a plan:

# Create artifact from source
# Run tests

This works fine using Atlassian Cloud storage for the generated artifacts.
When enabling S3 storage, the executable bits are not stored (I both downloaded artifact from S3 and did not see the permission bits, and logged in on the bamboo agent to check the (the lack of) executable bits)

I noticed https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-13507 and saw it is fixed, but it (still) does not work for us. Is this a (known) regression?
fields.summary: Artifacts sharing does not preserve permissions on S3

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a log file has not been generated in Bamboo an ERROR log is recorded. Even when the build is still in queue. 

h3. Expected Behavior 
The log tab should either be disabled if the build hasn't been started  or the "INFO" message like "The log hasn't been generated....." instead of an "ERROR"

h3. Actual Result
ERROR log recorded in atlassian-bamboo.log
{noformat}
ERROR [http-nio-8443-exec-11] [ViewChainLogs] Failed to load build logs for build DTD-DDT-3
{noformat}
fields.summary: Improve log tab behavior and logging in Bamboo when log file has not been generated yet

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The logged error message about why an artifact can't be created isn't detailed enough to be useful. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start Bamboo Server on Windows
# Setup plan with artifact. 
#* Artifact name: *.txt
#* Pattern: *.txt
# Run build

h3. Expected Results
An error message in the logs that the folder for the artifact can't be created.

h3. Actual Results
An error message in the logs that theartifact can't be published, but without any clue that problem is about the artifact declaration name. 

h3.Workaround
Don't use special characters (? or *) in artifact name.
fields.summary: When artifact name has special characters it should be visible in error message

fields.description:
We have just migrated from local users to external users, held in an openLDAP database.

Migration has worked as described and we have no issues with authentication and permissions

However the Users' menu, from the extreme RH end of the toolbar, has disappeared and along with it the 'log out' option.

Can you advise how we get this back please.
fields.summary: Log-out option has dissappeared in bamboo after conversion to LDAP

fields.description: We have plugin in the Marketplace that runs Selenium Tests. Most folks prefer to run the selenium tests after they have deployed code to some environment. This is particularly true after a complete deployment task. The problem however is Bamboo has no way of reporting test reports in deployment plans. Also when we try to run our plugin, we find that testCollationService.collateTestResults(*taskContext*, testFilePattern, new MyUnitTestReportCollector()) fails. This is because *CommonTaskContext* type is not supported for this method in place of *TaskContext* type. Please make this available for DeploymentPlans. Also allow JUNIT type results displayable for deployment plans.
fields.summary: Support Test Collation in Deployment Task

fields.description:
Currently, any AWS CodeDeploy deployment task is limited to 15 minutes via a poller that runs once every 60 seconds for up to 15 retries.

These should be configurable.

When you have a CodeDeploy Policy of one-at-a-time, a bunch of servers, and a ValidateServer task that ensures the server is up before moving onto the next one, it's trivial to hit this timeout limit.
fields.summary: AWS CodeDeploy is hard-coded to a 15 minute timeout

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently if the Bamboo server goes offline while a build is running on a remote agent, the build results are lost because the remote agent cannot deliver them to the Bamboo server, even if the server comes back before the build is complete.

With builds running for many hours or even days that is a waste of resources and time.

h3. Suggested Solution

Even though the Bamboo server has gone offline while the build was running, a remote agent should keep retrying the result delivery to the server. Once the server is back up, the remote agent should be able to deliver the build results to the server.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround available
fields.summary: As an administrator I want remote agents to be able to deliver build results even if the server had gone offline while the build was running

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Import into Oracle fail when there is truncated data for FAILURE_REASON in MERGE_RESULT table.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup Bamboo using HSQLDB
 # Create a plan with auto merge enabled in its branch plan
 # Replicate a conflict merge so that the git error message has more than 4000 characters.
 # Run the branch plan. The build should fail with a long failure reason in _Branch Integration Details_
 # Create a export with the build results
 # Import the export into a instance connected to Oracle DB

h3. Expected Results

Import successful as the failure reason message should have been truncated as per the fix --BAM-12128--
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2016-05-31 15:31:22,472 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-7] [JDBCExceptionReporter] ORA-01461: can bind a LONG value only for insert into a LONG column
{noformat}
h3. Notes
 * Possible that the horizontal ellipsis {{…}} character that is added after data truncation is stored as more than 1 byte in the DB.
 * Error only occurs in Oracle DB. Import works for MySQL db.

 * {{…}} is stored as 3 bytes in the database. MySQL returns a length of 3 but a char_length of 1 for {{…}}. However, this value is only accurate if the query from the columns. {{length("…")}} returns 1.

 
 * *Check if VARCHAR2 columns in Oracle database have length defined in characters and not bytes*, e.g. the MERGE_RESULT.FAILURE_REASON should have:

{noformat}"FAILURE_REASON" VARCHAR2(4000 CHAR){noformat}


h3. Workaround
 # Stop Bamboo
 # Edit the database and remove any occurrence of {{…}} ({{\u2026}} in HSQLDB) in the {{merge_result}} table
 (!) Always take a dump or backup of the database before attempting manual edit
 # Perform the export
fields.summary: Import into Oracle DB fail when there is truncated data for FAILURE_REASON in MERGE_RESULT table

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bamboo End of Life was announced recently, as you can see on [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboocloud/bamboo-cloud-eol-827125716.html],  and it seems that only users with an license already in progress will be able to continue using bamboo cloud.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
Open the Hamburguer menu on the left-top corner, and try to add bamboo product, you will receive a message that bamboo is activated.

h3. Expected Results
Since Bamboo is being removed we expect that the option to add bamboo will not be displayed

h3. Actual Results
We can see bamboo banner to click and add it.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Cloud Workaround
None
fields.summary: Bamboo is displayed on Cloud instance as an option to subscribe

fields.description:
When using:
- the Docker task to run a container, and
- the "Detach container" feature, with
- the "Wait for service to start" feature,

if the "Wait for service to start" check times out, it will pass the task instead of failing it. Example logs:
{noformat}
simple	27-May-2016 07:41:56	Checking connectivity to deployed server: http://localhost:8080
simple	27-May-2016 07:41:56	Attempting connection to http://localhost:8080
simple	27-May-2016 07:41:56	Failed connecting to http://localhost:8080, error: Connection refused
simple	27-May-2016 07:41:57	Attempting connection to http://localhost:8080
simple	27-May-2016 07:41:57	Failed connecting to http://localhost:8080, error: Connection refused
simple	27-May-2016 07:41:58	Attempting connection to http://localhost:8080
...

simple	27-May-2016 07:43:56	Failed connecting to http://localhost:8080, error: Connection refused
simple	27-May-2016 07:43:57	Attempting connection to http://localhost:8080
simple	27-May-2016 07:43:57	Failed connecting to http://localhost:8080, error: Connection refused
error	27-May-2016 07:43:57	Could not connect to http://localhost:8080, giving up after 120 seconds

{noformat}

If the task is configured to wait for the service to start and it doesn't start within the configured timeout period, it should fail the task.

fields.description:
As an admin I would like to be able to get the user who runs a JOB.
I've tried to use the variable *bamboo.ManualBuildTriggerReason.userName*, but this variable is useless in some situations. Its value is set to null every time a build is triggered for a reason different them manual, so if I manually run a JOB after a build triggered by other reason this variable wont be set leading me to the following error:
{noformat}... ${bamboo.ManualBuildTriggerReason.userName}: bad substitution{noformat} 

To fulfill the above gap I suggest adding the following variable: *bamboo.ManualJobTriggerReason.userName*. This variable should be set every time a JOB is run, so it could be used for JOBs even when they are manually run after a build not manually triggered.
fields.summary: Create a Bamboo variable to track the the users who manually runs a job

fields.description:
When an agent completes its Job, it sends it results back to the server and the server updates the database to mark the job as complated.

However, when the SQL update fails in some reason (MySQL deadlock etc), the Job will forever be _In Progress_ state. The only way to fix this would be to update the db manually. Viewing the build result page of said _limbo_ builds would cause an infinite auto refresh.

Suggestion: use OrphanedBuildMonitorJob to catch these cases
fields.summary: Branch gets stuck in eternal InProgress state when db failed to update its status because of a deadlock

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bamboo is no longer able to handle artifacts whose filenames have an umlaut (¨). It fails to publish artifacts in this case.

h3. Environment
We can replicate it in Bamboo {{5.12.0-D20160518T090318}} but we cannot replicate in {{5.10-OD-15-001}} (haven't tested in other versions), which shows this has changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a build plan in Bamboo with a single task: a script task
# Add the following code to the task: {{echo Test > testumlaut_ü.test}}
#* Notice that the last ‘u’ has an umlaut
# Create an artifact definition that includes the generated file (tested with shared artifacts)
#* A simple copy pattern like ‘*’ is enough
# Run the plan

h3. Expected Results
The build is successfully run and the ‘testumlaut_ü.test’ is added as an artifact in the build result.

h3. Actual Results
Though the build is successful, it doesn’t contain any artifacts.
The build log shows this:
{noformat}
error	24-May-2016 15:04:55	Unable to publish artifact [Test]: 
simple	24-May-2016 15:04:55	The artifact hasn't been successfully published after 13.33 s
{noformat}

The Bamboo Server logs show this:
{noformat}
2016-05-26 22:29:57.397037500 2016-05-26 22:29:57,396 INFO [http-nio-6990-exec-4] [ArtifactServlet] Receiving Artifact [Test] for TEST-TEST-JOB1-2
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400482500 2016-05-26 22:29:57,399 ERROR [http-nio-6990-exec-4] [ArtifactServlet] Exception when storing the artifact
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400483500 java.nio.file.InvalidPathException: Malformed input or input contains unmappable characters: testumlaut_ü.test
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400483500 	at sun.nio.fs.UnixPath.encode(UnixPath.java:147)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400483500 	at sun.nio.fs.UnixPath.<init>(UnixPath.java:71)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400484500 	at sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystem.getPath(UnixFileSystem.java:281)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400484500 	at sun.nio.fs.AbstractPath.resolve(AbstractPath.java:53)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400489500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.BambooFiles.resolvePathUnderParent(BambooFiles.java:170)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400489500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.messages.ArtifactStreams.deserialiseStreamToDir(ArtifactStreams.java:79)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400490500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.messaging.ArtifactServlet.storeArtifact(ArtifactServlet.java:114)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400490500 	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.messaging.ArtifactServlet.doPost(ArtifactServlet.java:100)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400492500 	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:648)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400492500 	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:729)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400492500 	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:291)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400495500 	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
2016-05-26 22:29:57.400496500 	at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:39)
{noformat}

The agent logs show this:
{noformat}
2016-05-24 15:19:22,865 ERROR [0-BAM::Elastic Agent on i-72c963cf::Agent:pool-3-thread-1] [BambooArtifactHttpTransport] Unexpected HTTP status code: HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
2016-05-24 15:19:22,865 INFO [0-BAM::Elastic Agent on i-72c963cf::Agent:pool-3-thread-1] [AbstractArtifactManager] Handler com.atlassian.bamboo.build.artifact.BambooRemoteArtifactHandler did not publish the artifact
2016-05-24 15:19:22,866 WARN [0-BAM::Elastic Agent on i-72c963cf::Agent:pool-3-thread-1] [AbstractArtifactManager] Unable to publish artifact [test]:
{noformat}


h3. Notes
This is the only invalid character found so far, but there may be others.

h3.Workaround
Change tasks to generate file names without the ‘umlaut’.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At present it's only possible to create a branch variable that overrides an existing variable for the master branch in the plan. This means that branches can't have their own specific variables.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow branch variables to be added that don't exist in the master branch.
 
h3. Workaround

None.

*Workarounds*

There are two possible workarounds here, but first we need to remove the _Source Code Checkout_ task from the Environment task configuration to prevent the deployment from failing.

h6. 1. Artifact

A workaround would be to download the code, from the target repository, using the _Source Code Checkout_ in the source build plan. It is possible to create a [shared artifact|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Sharing+artifacts] to wrap up all the downloaded code and then use the *Artifact download* task in the Environment to download the artifact containing the source code downloaded from the source build plan.

h6. 2. Script

A different workaround would be to use a [Script|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Script] task inside the Environment to manually clone the repository, the same way that it's done using the Terminal or Command Prompt.

h3. Summary

# Set Bamboo 5.12.0.2 to use the same Bamboo Home

fields.description:
One problem that we encounter on our internal instances is as follows:
# Bamboo has a lot of different image configurations each providing specific capabilities
# Bamboo server has a large queue of jobs, all requiring the same basic capabilities
# To handle this queue, Bamboo spins up the same image on many agents. Bamboo reaches its elastic agent limit
# A new job comes into the queue which requires a different image. At the same time, more jobs that only need the capabilities of the many agents that are already available
# The unique job makes its way to the top of the queue, but is constantly leapfrogged by jobs that can use one of the already running agents
# Because the server is at max agent capacity, Bamboo doesn't spin up any new images to handle the unique job's requirements
# The unique job is stuck at the top of the queue, waiting (potentially for a long time) for the queue to die down enough for Bamboo to kill an agent and bring up a new one that meets its requirements

To fix this, Bamboo would need to recognise that there is a job that can't be run in the queue, and proactively shutdown one of the running images and bring up a new, more diverse one that can handle the requirements of the job at the top of the queue.
fields.summary: Spin up diverse agents when elastic limit is hit

h3. Summary

When retrieving failed test results, there is no cap on the amount of data retrieved from the database so the whole operation can take a long time to complete and can consume a lot of memory. If several operations like this happen at the same time, the server can run out of memory.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
n/a

h3. Expected Results

Results are capped or paged.

h3. Actual Results
All results are returned.
 
h3.Workaround
n/a

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Deployment plan infinitely queued / waiting and not being picked up despite available agents.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate a build plan with 2 tasks, the last task is to produce a shared artifact.
 # Define a deployment project and use the shared artifact.
 # Run the build, create a release and deploy it.
 # Remove the second task from build plan, this removes the shared artifact definition.
 # Run the build (which does not create a shared artifact anymore).
 # Create a release and click on "Start deployment"

h3. Expected Results

Fail the build gracefully with meaningful communication.
h3. Actual Results

Deployment Plan is queued infinitely.

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log / catalina.out file:
{noformat}
2016-07-15 10:39:31,602 WARN [10-BAM::PlanExec:pool-18-thread-1] [ArtifactDownloaderRuntimeDataProvider] Unable to find an artifact definition for name: ...
2016-07-15 10:39:31,602 ERROR [10-BAM::PlanExec:pool-18-thread-1] [ChainPluginSupportHelper] Task context data provider failed:java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to find an artifact definition for name: ...
2016-07-15 10:39:31,602 INFO [10-BAM::PlanExec:pool-18-thread-1] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-artifact-downloader-plugin:artifactdownloadertask : 222068744-222134304 : Unable to find an artifact definition for name: ...

{noformat}
h3. Notes

Environment deployment history page ([https://mydomainhere/bamboo/deploy/viewEnvironment.action?id=9273345]) shows the deployment e.g. as "Waiting for xxx minutes".
h3. Workaround

When you re-add the artifact definition to the build task, run the build, re-select the artifact in deployment project tasks, create a release and click on start deployment, the deployment will be executed. All older deployment jobs stay in queue forever as "queued".
fields.summary: Endless waiting / queued deployment jobs

fields.description:
The "Viewing the list of Bamboo stock images" documentation doesn't apply to latest Bamboo versions.

URL:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamkb/list-of-atlassian-ami-ids-744721326.html
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOOCLOUD/Viewing+the+list+of+Bamboo+stock+images

\\
h3. Problem description:
The script in above pages is trying to connect to below url:
- https://maven.atlassian.com/content/repositories/atlassian-public/com/atlassian/bamboo/atlassian-bamboo/$BAMBOO_VERSION/atlassian-bamboo-$BAMBOO_VERSION.pom 

Where $BAMBOO_VERSION is the Bamboo version for which you are searching the stock images for. 

However, the latest Cloud version is 5.12.0 and the latest Server version is 5.11.4 and if I go to:
- https://maven.atlassian.com/content/repositories/atlassian-public/com/atlassian/bamboo/atlassian-bamboo/

None of above versions available:
{noformat}
Index of /repositories/atlassian-public/com/atlassian/bamboo/atlassian-bamboo

Name	Last Modified	Size	Description
Parent Directory
5.8.3/	Fri May 13 14:24:54 UTC 2016	 	
5.9.10/	Tue Mar 22 12:05:36 UTC 2016	 	
5.9.3/	Mon Mar 14 04:29:07 UTC 2016	 	
5.9.7/	Mon Mar 14 07:06:04 UTC 2016	 	
maven-metadata.xml	Thu Apr 07 02:28:42 UTC 2016	1997	
maven-metadata.xml.sha1	Thu Apr 07 02:28:42 UTC 2016 
{noformat}

Therefore, running the script or following the manual steps results in 404 - page not found error.

\\
h3. Workaround:
To know the list of the stock images available for a specific region, please do the following:
# Go to Bamboo administration
# Go to *ELASTIC BAMBOO* > *Configuration*
# Edit the configuration and select the desired region

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With automatic integration, Clover Results Collector tries to find clover.xml in the wrong subdirectory in a job that involves an Ant task when another non-VCS checkout task (e.g. Script) is present above it in the task order.

The search pattern applied is:
{{/target/site/clover/**/clover.xml}} (which is applicable for Maven tasks) 

Instead of:
{{/clover/**/clover.xml}} (for Ant)

Impact: Clover tab is not visible for a Job. Clover statistics are not available in build Metadata after the build. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a basic plan and job
# Setup the following task order:
## Script
## Source code checkout
## Ant build
# Go to the miscellaneous tab of the job and:
## Check 'Use Clover to collect Code Coverage for this build.'
## Enable 'Automatically integrate Clover into this build.'
# Save (Regardless of if you've changed the clover integration setting. This should trigger the clover XML location to update incorrectly based on the first task) 
# Trigger a build

h3. Expected Results
Clover Results Collector tries to find clover.xml in the correct pattern for Ant: /clover/**/clover.xml

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is reported in atlassian-bamboo.log
{noformat}
[ExecuteBuildTask] Failed to execute plugin with class com.atlassian.bamboo.clover.builder.coverage.CloverBuildProcessor : ANT-JOB1-1
java.lang.Exception: No file matches the specified pattern:target/site/clover/**/clover.xml in [/var/bamboo-home/xml-data/build-dir/ANT-JOB1]
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.clover.builder.coverage.CloverBuildProcessor.call(CloverBuildProcessor.java:156)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.tasks.ExecuteBuildTask.performCustomBuildProcess(ExecuteBuildTask.java:158)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.tasks.ExecuteBuildTask.call(ExecuteBuildTask.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent.build(DefaultBuildAgent.java:215)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.BuildAgentControllerImpl$1.call(BuildAgentControllerImpl.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.BuildAgentControllerImpl$1.call(BuildAgentControllerImpl.java:130)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.variable.CustomVariableContextImpl.withVariableSubstitutor(CustomVariableContextImpl.java:221)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.BuildAgentControllerImpl.waitAndPerformBuild(BuildAgentControllerImpl.java:129)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent$1.run(DefaultBuildAgent.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.BambooRunnables$1.run(BambooRunnables.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper.runWith(ImpersonationHelper.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper.runWithSystemAuthority(ImpersonationHelper.java:20)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.security.ImpersonationHelper$1.run(ImpersonationHelper.java:52)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

Following is present in the build log:
{noformat}
Failed to execute plugin 'Clover Results Collector' with error: No file matches the specified pattern:target/site/clover/**/clover.xml in [/var/bamboo-home/xml-data/build-dir/ANT-JOB1]
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Configure the plan and job.
# Move the Ant task to the top of the job so it's the first task
# Go to the miscellaneous tab of the job:
## Ensure 'Automatically integrate Clover into this build.' is checked.
## Save - regardless of whether changes are made to automatically integrate clover. This should trigger a path update with Ant as the first task.
# Go back to the Task tab and return the Ant task to it's appropriate position in the job. (Don't save the miscellaneous tab again after you've moved Ant back down the task order)
fields.summary: Clover Results Collector looking for clover.xml in wrong location (Ant)

fields.description:
If a remote event consumer (JIRA, Bamboo, FeCru, etc) has a Base URL which does not match the URL used by AppLinks then _all_ remote events are dropped silently (i.e. a mismatch in JIRA will cause Stash not to send remote events to Bamboo, for example).

Consumers publish via REST the event capabilities they can handle with their corresponding URL. Said URL is created using the application's Base URL. When that URL does not match the AppLinks URL the event cannot be sent.

Error from Bitbucket Server side:
{noformat}
2016-06-28 19:38:27,726 ERROR [events.remote.ratelimit.threads:thread-1] kahloun.foong @IAA69Lx1178x15x0 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 "POST /scm/tst/stash.git/git-receive-pack HTTP/1.1" c.a.e.r.impl.RemoteEventDispatcher Error dispatching Set(com.atlassian.stash.plugin.remote.event.StashBranchChangedRemoteEvent@e2ab958[branchName=master,repositoryProject=TST,repositorySlug=stash,committer=kahloun.foong,sourceId=<null>,sourceUrl=<null>]) to Atlassian Bamboo (4d84b08d-478f-303e-8dc0-b3190ae85ef7) http://localhost:8085 bamboo
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Request url 'http://10.60.2.227:8085/rest/remote-event-consumer/latest/events/stash-branch-changed-remote-event' doesn't match rpc url 'http://localhost:8085'
	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:145) ~[guava-18.0.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.applinks.core.auth.ApplicationLinkRequestFactoryFactoryImpl$AbsoluteURLRequestFactory.createRequest(ApplicationLinkRequestFactoryFactoryImpl.java:199) ~[na:na]
	at com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.RemoteEventDispatcher$$anonfun$com$atlassian$event$remote$impl$RemoteEventDispatcher$$createRequest$1.apply(RemoteEventDispatcher.scala:83) ~[atlassian-remote-event-producer-plugin-1.0.9-D20151109T070900.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.RemoteEventDispatcher$$anonfun$com$atlassian$event$remote$impl$RemoteEventDispatcher$$createRequest$1.apply(RemoteEventDispatcher.scala:83) ~[atlassian-remote-event-producer-plugin-1.0.9-D20151109T070900.jar:na]
	at scala.util.control.Exception$Catch$$anonfun$either$1.apply(Exception.scala:124) ~[scala-2.10-provider-plugin-0.9.jar:na]
	at scala.util.control.Exception$Catch$$anonfun$either$1.apply(Exception.scala:124) ~[scala-2.10-provider-plugin-0.9.jar:na]
	at scala.util.control.Exception$Catch.apply(Exception.scala:102) ~[scala-2.10-provider-plugin-0.9.jar:na]
	at scala.util.control.Exception$Catch.either(Exception.scala:124) ~[scala-2.10-provider-plugin-0.9.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.RemoteEventDispatcher.com$atlassian$event$remote$impl$RemoteEventDispatcher$$createRequest(RemoteEventDispatcher.scala:82) [atlassian-remote-event-producer-plugin-1.0.9-D20151109T070900.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.event.remote.impl.RemoteEventDispatcher$$anonfun$com$atlassian$event$remote$impl$RemoteEventDispatcher$$dispatchToAppLink$2.apply(RemoteEventDispatcher.scala:105) ~[atlassian-remote-event-producer-plugin-1.0.9-D20151109T070900.jar:na]
{noformat}


h2. Workaround
# Stop Bamboo
# Locate the following files inside *$BAMBOO_INSTALL/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins*, and move them to a backup location. Please do not delete them but note that they *must* be removed from your Bamboo installation.
#* *atlassian-remote-event-common-plugin-1.0.6-D20150716T084030.jar*
#* *atlassian-remote-event-producer-plugin-1.0.6-D20150716T084030.jar*
#* *atlassian-remote-event-consumer-plugin-1.0.6-D20150716T084030.jar*
# Updated versions of these plugins are attached to this issue. Save the attached JAR files to *$BAMBOO_INSTALL/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins* and ensure the permissions are correct (e.g. {{chown -R bamboo_user: $BAMBOO_INSTALL/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins}}, where {{bamboo_user}} is your local OS user that runs Bamboo)
# Start Bamboo
fields.summary: Remote events fail silently if Base URL does not match Application Link URL

fields.description:
Consider the following flow:
{noformat}
DefaultChangeDetectionManager#collectChangesWithRetry
  DefaultChangeDetectionManager#handleRepositoryExceptionForDeletedBranchWithRetry
    DefaultChangeDetectionManager#handleRepositoryExceptionForDeletedBranch
      ChainBranchManagerImpl#handleVcsBranchDeletedOfPlanBranch
{noformat}
This is how exception thrown during change detection will lead to branch being marked as deleted.
Then branch expiry could remove such branch.

h4. Possible ways to fix it
* make smarter decision when marking branch as deleted
* make BranchDeletionService verify such branches and reopen them?

h4. Workaround
Disable deletion on branch expiry configuration for a plan.
fields.summary: Branches are marked as deleted when an error occurs during change detection.

fields.description:
Currently, Bamboo creates and store build logs in separate directories according to their Job key. This location is not configurable at the moment.

In certain cases, ability to change these directories would be useful, for example, storing all the build logs in one location.
fields.summary: Ability to change location of Bamboo build logs

fields.description:
When I'm looking at recently built projects in Bamboo, it will say something like "4 minutes ago" or "2 days ago". If I mouse over those strings, it pops up a tooltip that shows the approximate time of the build (e.g. "Fri, 13 May, 07:48 PM"). There are several problems with this:

0) "X minutes ago" is only useful if I know when the page was loaded. Nothing on the page indicates the loading time, so if I look at such a page several minutes (or hours) after it was loaded, I have no idea how long ago "X minutes ago" was. Maybe a Javascript timer to update the times in the page every so often so that it remains accurate when the page is open for long periods? It's not at all uncommon to have numerous tabs open and come back to them later.

1) I'm in PDT (-0700) and the time displayed is UTC (+0000). Other people using the same Bamboo instance are scattered around the world; I want times displayed to me in my time zone, and they want theirs. Forcing us all to agree on a single time zone display (when we have individual logins!) is suboptimal. I should be able to set a time zone in my user profile.

2) The format of the displayed timestamp (D, d M, h:i) is not remotely what I want. I want to be able to set a UNIX `date (1)`-style time string so that it shows time stamps the way I want them. (At the very least, give us a few preconfigured options, like ISO 8601, US, UK, whatever.)

3) Software intended for use by people distributed over a wide area should always, ALWAYS display a time zone with a timestamp. The example above ("Fri, 13 May, 07:48 PM") is increasingly meaningless the longer the page has been open. In order to get an accurate timestamp, I have to reload the page. This is obviously less of an issue if the above issues are addressed, but still: there is no good reason to ever fail to display a time zone in an environment like this.
fields.summary: Per-user time zone settings

fields.description:
I believe this is similar to (and possibly identical to but I can't tell) BAM-14857 and BAM-17463 in that it is about task configuration, etc. not getting updated immediately.

If you have a deployment with an Artifact Downloader task configured to download a specific artifact from the linked build plan and then clone the deployment the cloned deployment reverts to showing 'All Artifacts' instead of the selected artifact and the deployment does not work (it stalls and when you manually stop it it then reports that it couldn't download the artifact).

If you edit the deployment environment and re-select the desired artifact (even if it is the same artifact as was originally configured) that seems to update some internal data that allows the download to work when the deployment is next attempted.
fields.summary: Cloned deployments do not update artifact downloader task internal details.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Non-detached Docker containers started from Bamboo are not stopped if build was cancelled manually. These containers will continue running and consume CPU on the host.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure build plan to start a Docker container
# Start the build
# When build is running, manually cancel the build using {{Actions >> Stop build}}

h3. Expected Results
The task should end gracefully by cleaning up the non detached docker containers it has spun up

h3. Actual Results
Docker containers started by the build will continue running in the background consuming CPU.
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2016-05-11 13:27:34,864 INFO [13-BAM::Default Agent::Agent:pool-29-thread-1] [TaskResultBuilder] DOCK-TEST-JOB1-15: Failing task since return code of [/usr/local/bin/docker run --volume /Users/brosa/Documents/Atlassian/bamboo/bamboo-5.9.7/home/xml-data/build-dir/DOCK-TEST-JOB1:/data --workdir /data --rm brosadocker/customized-bamboo-java-agent:1.0.0] was 141 while expected 0
2016-05-11 13:27:34,865 INFO [13-BAM::Default Agent::Agent:pool-29-thread-1] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: Error occurred while running Task '(2)' of type com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bamboo-docker-plugin:task.docker.cli. : DOCK-TEST-JOB1 : Failed to execute task

fields.description:
Currently, Bamboo automatically sends build status notification for all builds from Stash / Bitbucket Server type repositories. 

Bamboo should provide an option to disable sending build status notification at both the plan / job or repository level. 

h2. Workaround

Convert the repository from *Bitbucket Server* type to standard *Git*. You will lose the benefits of Bitbucket Server integration, such as push based triggering and branch detection as well as pull request integration and automated SSH authentication management but build statuses will not be sent to Bitbucket for this repository if it's standard *Git*.
fields.summary: Provide option to disable Stash/Bitbucket Server build status notification
Can't add or edit build plan branch variables in Bamboo Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bamboo (MySQL database only) is not able to build branch names that contain umlaut characters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a branch with umlaut characters such as {{UmläutTest}} in Bitbucket Server
# Create a linked repository to the repo and point it to the umlaut named branch
# Save

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo should save the configuration with no errors.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2016-05-11 16:20:56,844 INFO [http-nio-8085-exec-22] [StashRepository] Can't authenticate with Bitbucket Server despite successful public key storage: <public key> <bamboo URL>
{noformat}

h3. Extent
* When the repository is configured as a _Git_ type repository with the clone URL pointing to the umlaut branch, the configuration will be successful. However, starting the plan will throw such an error:
{noformat:borderStyle=dashed}
2016-05-11 16:29:19,234 ERROR [6-DelayedChangeDetectionThread:pool-12-thread-14] [ChainExecutionManagerImpl] Plan 'TEST-STAS' could not be started. Exception: Cannot determine head revision of 'http://derics-mbp.local:7990/stash/scm/test/bambootest.git' on branch 'newUmla?utTest'. Branch has probably been removed.
com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.InvalidRepositoryException: Cannot determine head revision of 'http://derics-mbp.local:7990/stash/scm/test/bambootest.git' on branch 'newUmla?utTest'. Branch has probably been removed.
{noformat}
* When the plan is configured to create branch plans automatically, Bamboo will repetively create new branch plans for these umlaut branch but none of this will be enabled

h3. Workaround
h4. MySQL
Add this parameter to the MySQL URL to prevent repetition of the branch creation:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8
{code}
Example:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
jdbc:mysql://localhost/bamboo?autoReconnect=true&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8
{code}
Other databases are not affected.
fields.summary: Branch names with umlaut characters for Bitbucket Server repos can't be configured in branch plan

fields.description:
Hi team,

Earlier we are using Teamcity.. and now moving towards Bamboo... but we have found few features missing in Bamboo that we are using in Teamcity.

One such feature is putting checkout rules that will help us to checkout only specific folders from repository we configured in Teamcity, but in Bamboo we have to configure multiple repos for the same.

It will be help ful if we can have this featrue in Bamboo as well.

I have attached the image for the same. one in yellow oval is our VCS and the one in red is checkout rules for that vcs.
fields.summary: Setting to put checkout rules

fields.description:
Hi team,

Earlier we are using Teamcity.. and now moving towards Bamboo... but we have found few features missing in Bamboo that we are using in Teamcity.

One such feature is to schedule the builds but it will execute the build only if there are pending changes, else it will not trigger the build.. this feature is available as an option in Teamcity along side scheduled trigger as a check box.

Would be great if we can have same feature in Bamboo as well.
fields.summary: Schedule trigger to run only if there are pending changes
